page.title: 14MONKSWOOD WATCH
page.content: At first sight nothing seems to happen in Monkswood but on deeper thought there are many neighbourly gestures we take for granted. Because the bus service is curtailed, neighbours are generous with their cars so that shopping and prescriptions can be collected and library books changed regularly.Old folk are visited;pets whose owners are away,are cared for;children are met from the school bus if "mum"is delayed.Excess garden produce and plants are exchanged over the garden fence together with gossip.The menfolk are ready to help by lending tools and skills. The church has a small regular congregation with numbers increasing for special services. People are kind and generous,always willing to offer help when necessary.
